is just a template - feel free to delete any and all of it and replace as appropriate.-->

### Configuration

* Which version of .NET is the code running on? **NET Core 3.1**
* What OS and version, and what distro if applicable? **Host is CentOS Linux release 7.7.1908 (Core), docker image Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster)**
* What is the architecture (x64, x86, ARM, ARM64)? **x64**
* GC mode: **server**

### App is completely frozen, unresponsive

**[clrstack -f -all](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/files/5187107/stacks.txt)**
* it seems to be GC issue because 
```
> threadpool
CPU utilization: 81 %%
Worker Thread: Total: 8 Running: 8 Idle: 0 MaxLimit: 32767 MinLimit: 100
Work Request in Queue: 4
    Unknown Function: 00007F9395D3BD70  Context: 000000000158BB60
    Unknown Function: 00007F9395D3BD70  Context: 00007F8E680053B0
    Unknown Function: 00007F9395D3BD70  Context: 00007F8E90002BD0
    Unknown Function: 00007F9395D3BD70  Context: 00007F8E9C021450
--------------------------------------
Number of Timers: 0
--------------------------------------
Completion Port Thread:Total: 0 Free: 0 MaxFree: 8 CurrentLimit: 0 MaxLimit: 1000 MinLimit: 4
```

Finalizer thread seems to be stuck on garbage collection
```
OS Thread Id: 0xd
        Child SP               IP Call Site
00007F9393250840 00007F9396D0300C libpthread.so.0!__pthread_cond_wait + 508
00007F9393250910 00007F9396041585 libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::CPalSynchronizationManager::ThreadNativeWait(CorUnix::_ThreadNativeWaitData*, unsigned int, CorUnix::ThreadWakeupReason*, unsigned int*) + 309
00007F9393250970 00007F9396041194 libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::CPalSynchronizationManager::BlockThread(CorUnix::CPalThread*, unsigned int, bool, bool, CorUnix::ThreadWakeupReason*, unsigned int*) + 388
00007F93932509D0 00007F93960457AF libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::InternalWaitForMultipleObjectsEx(CorUnix::CPalThread*, unsigned int, void* const*, int, unsigned int, int, int) + 1743
00007F9393250B60 00007F9396045A59 libcoreclr.so!WaitForSingleObjectEx + 89
00007F9393250BA0 00007F9395DE19F4 libcoreclr.so!CLREventBase::WaitEx(unsigned int, WaitMode, PendingSync*) + 228
00007F9393250C40 00007F9395ED818E libcoreclr.so!SVR::GCHeap::GarbageCollectGeneration(unsigned int, gc_reason) + 638
00007F9393250C90 00007F9395EFCF25 libcoreclr.so!SVR::GCHeap::GarbageCollect(int, bool, int) + 773
00007F9393250CD0 00007F9395D7745A libcoreclr.so!FinalizerThread::FinalizerThreadWorker(void*) + 330
00007F9393250D10 00007F9395D19645 libcoreclr.so!ManagedThreadBase_DispatchOuter(ManagedThreadCallState*) + 341
00007F9393250D60                  [DebuggerU2MCatchHandlerFrame: 00007f9393250d60]
00007F9393250E30 00007F9395D19CFD libcoreclr.so!ManagedThreadBase::FinalizerBase(void (*)(void*)) + 45
00007F9393250E60 00007F9395D775AC libcoreclr.so!FinalizerThread::FinalizerThreadStart(void*) + 188
00007F9393250EE0 00007F939604B73D libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::CPalThread::ThreadEntry(void*) + 349
00007F9393250F00 00007F9396CFCFA3 libpthread.so.0!start_thread + 243
00007F9393250FC0 00007F93969074CF libc.so.6!clone + 63
```

4 GC threads seems to be waiting (4 CPU):
3 GC threads are waiting to enter critical section
```
OS Thread Id: 0x21
        Child SP               IP Call Site
00007F8E717F9AF0 00007F9396D0300C libpthread.so.0!__pthread_cond_wait + 508
00007F8E717F9BC0 00007F939603C6F2 libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::InternalEnterCriticalSection(CorUnix::CPalThread*, _CRITICAL_SECTION*) + 530
00007F8E717F9C20 00007F9395C98225 libcoreclr.so!CrstBase::Enter() + 213
00007F8E717F9C60 00007F9395E19CD2 libcoreclr.so!AppDomain::AssemblyIterator::Next(CollectibleAssemblyHolder<DomainAssembly*>*) + 34
00007F8E717F9C90 00007F9395E1B48B libcoreclr.so!AppDomain::EnumStaticGCRefs(void (*)(Object**, ScanContext*, unsigned int), ScanContext*) + 123
00007F8E717F9D00 00007F9395F3706E libcoreclr.so!GCToEEInterface::GcScanRoots(void (*)(Object**, ScanContext*, unsigned int), int, int, ScanContext*) + 126
00007F8E717F9D40 00007F9395EDD678 libcoreclr.so!SVR::gc_heap::background_mark_phase() + 280
00007F8E717F9E00 00007F9395EDC806 libcoreclr.so!SVR::gc_heap::gc1() + 438
00007F8E717F9E60 00007F9395EF4A8F libcoreclr.so!SVR::gc_heap::bgc_thread_function() + 191
00007F8E717F9EA0 00007F9395F395D2 libcoreclr.so!(anonymous namespace)::CreateSuspendableThread(void (*)(void*), void*, char16_t const*)::$_0::__invoke(void*) + 210
00007F8E717F9EE0 00007F939604B73D libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::CPalThread::ThreadEntry(void*) + 349
00007F8E717F9F00 00007F9396CFCFA3 libpthread.so.0!start_thread + 243
00007F8E717F9FC0 00007F93969074CF libc.so.6!clone + 63
```
1 is waiting on something else
```
OS Thread Id: 0x20
        Child SP               IP Call Site
00007F8E71FFA900 00007F9396D0300C libpthread.so.0!__pthread_cond_wait + 508
00007F8E71FFA9D0 00007F9396041585 libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::CPalSynchronizationManager::ThreadNativeWait(CorUnix::_ThreadNativeWaitData*, unsigned int, CorUnix::ThreadWakeupReason*, unsigned int*) + 309

00007F8E71FFAD40 00007F9395EDD762 libcoreclr.so!SVR::gc_heap::background_mark_phase() + 514

00007F8E71FFAEE0 00007F939604B73D libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::CPalThread::ThreadEntry(void*) + 349
00007F8E71FFAF00 00007F9396CFCFA3 libpthread.so.0!start_thread + 243
00007F8E71FFAFC0 00007F93969074CF libc.so.6!clone + 63
```

Almost all other threads looks like this:
```
00007F8E4BFFE0B0 00007F9396D0300C libpthread.so.0!__pthread_cond_wait + 508
00007F8E4BFFE180 00007F9396041585 libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::CPalSynchronizationManager::ThreadNativeWait(CorUnix::_ThreadNativeWaitData*, unsigned int, CorUnix::ThreadWakeupReason*, unsigned int*) + 309
00007F8E4BFFE1E0 00007F9396041194 libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::CPalSynchronizationManager::BlockThread(CorUnix::CPalThread*, unsigned int, bool, bool, CorUnix::ThreadWakeupReason*, unsigned int*) + 388
00007F8E4BFFE240 00007F93960457AF libcoreclr.so!CorUnix::InternalWaitForMultipleObjectsEx(CorUnix::CPalThread*, unsigned int, void* const*, int, unsigned int, int, int) + 1743
00007F8E4BFFE3D0 00007F9396045A59 libcoreclr.so!WaitForSingleObjectEx + 89
00007F8E4BFFE410 00007F9395DE19F4 libcoreclr.so!CLREventBase::WaitEx(unsigned int, WaitMode, PendingSync*) + 228
00007F8E4BFFE4B0 00007F9395DE4D9B libcoreclr.so!Thread::RareDisablePreemptiveGC() + 427
```

I don't know why I didn't think to test the repro with the newer runtime earlier 😅 

I guess we should update to .NET 5 then, unless this is something that should still get fixed in 3.1?

Just out of curiosity, I tested the repro with the .NET 5 preview Docker images. Preview 3 locks up, while preview 4 does not. #32795 was already included in preview 3, so I guess the bug was fixed by some other later change.","performed_via_github_app":null}}
